58b643bd-9260-4f87-89e6-3acb157e10bc.title: What is React?
58b643bd-9260-4f87-89e6-3acb157e10bc.description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

55afc9fb-c3e8-4a1d-af9b-2a8c0308a4ba.title: How does useState work?
55afc9fb-c3e8-4a1d-af9b-2a8c0308a4ba.description: useState is a Hook that allows you to add state to functional components.

85d4f6cc-2c65-42c5-948e-959268a2521f.title: What is a component?
85d4f6cc-2c65-42c5-948e-959268a2521f.description: A component is a reusable piece of UI in React.

b2d7f8e1-3c4e-4a3e-9f8b-1c2d3e4f5a6b.title: What is JSX?
b2d7f8e1-3c4e-4a3e-9f8b-1c2d3e4f5a6b.description: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that looks similar to XML or HTML.

c3e8f9a1-4b2d-4c3e-9a1b-2d3e4f5a6b7c.title: What is a Hook?
c3e8f9a1-4b2d-4c3e-9a1b-2d3e4f5a6b7c.description: Hooks are functions that let you use state and other React features in functional components.

d4f9a2b1-5c3e-4d4e-9b2c-3e4f5a6b7c8d.title: What is Redux?
d4f9a2b1-5c3e-4d4e-9b2c-3e4f5a6b7c8d.description: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps, often used with React.

e5a6b7c8-6d4e-4e5f-9c3d-4f5a6b7c8d9e.title: What is Context API?
e5a6b7c8-6d4e-4e5f-9c3d-4f5a6b7c8d9e.description: The Context API is a React structure that enables you to exchange unique details and assists in solving prop-drilling.

f6b7c8d9-7e5f-4f6a-9d4e-5a6b7c8d9e0f.title: What is Prop Drilling?
f6b7c8d9-7e5f-4f6a-9d4e-5a6b7c8d9e0f.description: Prop drilling is the process of passing data from a parent component to a deeply nested child component through intermediary components.

g7c8d9e0-8f6a-4g7b-9e5f-6b7c8d9e0f1g.title: What is useEffect?
g7c8d9e0-8f6a-4g7b-9e5f-6b7c8d9e0f1g.description: useEffect is a Hook that lets you perform side effects in functional components.

h8d9e0f1-9g7b-4h8c-9f6a-7c8d9e0f1g2h.title: What is a Higher-Order Component?
h8d9e0f1-9g7b-4h8c-9f6a-7c8d9e0f1g2h.description: A higher-order component (HOC) is a function that takes a component and returns a new component.
